7/28/01 4:15:28 PM, "Daniel Paul Hightower" <dph_of_rules@...> wrote:

>this part is about your favorite and worst scenarios that are built-in 
>to the game.  Part 2 will be about favorites and worst from the 
>tevfifty.  Part 3 will be about dph's regular scenarios.
>
>What are the favorite scenarios?  What are the worst scenarios?
>
>

"The Island City of Thieves" is definitely a fun one (can't remember the scen#
offhand), as well as "Lake Tacona."  "Lake Tacona" is great when you've got
more than one person at the keyboard.

Scenarios that set me off a little are the ones that require me to pay an inordinate
amount of attention to my team (which is easily remedied by increasing the number
of HUMAN players).  "The Smell of the Dead" is one of these, where the battlefield
is so open that as long as I'm playing on Battle or Slaughter, there is always the
high chance that my teammates will get very stupid while I go off to complete some
important task (like destroy the tents).

-Chris
